paragraphs: I'm a Computer Science student at the University of Waterloo with a deep passion for machine learning and artificial intelligence. My story started in 2018 when I decided to prepare for the Physics Olympiad. Fast-forward to 2023, and I got 45th globally in the Sir Issac Newton's Physics Contest with over 3000 participants. Next year, I gave it another shot and I scored 49/48 (don't ask me how; I don't know either), and secured 26th place globally and 10th in Canada.

But Physics wasn't the only thing, I dedicated my time to. I also coded on the side and learned a lot. I have contributed to Machine Learning, Full Stack Development, Game Development, and Web Development projects. If there's one thing you should know about me, it's that <strong>I love challenges.<strong>

data.title: Machine Learning Engineer
bulletPoints: Developing an (ANN) algorithm utilizing TensorFlow to enhance operational performance
Optimizing the extraction, processing, and cleaning of data from the Diskos dataset
Engineering a predictive model leveraging Support Vector Machines (SVM) and real-time analysis to forecast stone formations

data.title: Lead Full Stack Web Developer
bulletPoints: Recruited and lead a team of three developers to architect, develop, and launch a dynamic web platform using NextJs that enhanced club connectivity with athletes
Engineered and integrated dynamic content management features using Prismic.io, streamlining update workflows
Designed the website using figma implementing new pages-including a gallery, executive profile, and store

data.title: Software Developer
bulletPoints: Developing a predictive model, Stock ML, using RNN (LSTM) to analyze stock market trends based on sentiment analysis of financial news and historical data
Building a web-scraping tool with Python, Newspaper3k, and Scrapy to gather targeted financial news for sentiment analysis
Integrating Alpha Vantage API to access and incorporate real-time and historical stock data into predictive analysis workflows
